pkg_for_practice.pkg_for_practice

Module Contents

Functions

cipher(text, shift, encrypt=True)

Function that replaces a given letter by a given number of positions forward or backward in the alphabet.
pkg_for_practice.pkg_for_practice.cipher(text, shift, encrypt=True)[source]

Function that replaces a given letter by a given number of positions forward or backward in the alphabet. Parameters: ———- text: str

A string of text for encryption or decryption.

shift: int

An integer indicating the digit(s) and directionality (- or +) of encryption/decryption.

encrypt: boolean

A boolean value indicating either True (encrypt) or False (decrypt).

new_text: str The encrypted or decrypted string.

>>> from cipher_mwf2120 import cipher_mwf2120
>>> a = 'c'
>>> b = -1
>>> cipher_mwf2120.cipher(a, b)
b
